publicationStmt.publisher: Pinakes Project - Institut de Recherche et d'Histoire des Textes (IRHT)

licence.p: Freely available for academic use. Digitized version available through the Vatican Library Digital Collections.

availability.p: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

msIdentifier.institution: Biblioteca Apostolica Vaticana Vatican Vatican City

msItem.title: Catena Patrum Graecorum in Prophetas (Patristic Commentaries on Prophets)

layout.p: Text in one column per page with approximately 29 lines per page.

handNote.p: Majuscule script (Coptic Majuscule), primarily from a single scribe with contributions by different hands in the scholia.

decoDesc.decoNote: Contains marginal notes and symbols indicating lectionary divisions, cross-references, and patristic scholia.

provenance.p: The codex likely did not come to Europe before the 9th century. It arrived in Lower Italy before the 12th century, then moved to the Abbey of S. Denis in Paris, France. It was owned by René Marchal in the second half of the 16th century and Cardinal F. Rochefoucaud in 1636, who donated it to the Jesuit College of Clermont in Paris. The manuscript came to the Vatican in 1785.
Owners: René Marchal, Cardinal F. Rochefoucaud.
